Detailed Description

Builds a response or request header for messages sent over the Comm layer.

An object of this type gets passed into the CommBuf constructor and is used to generate the message header.

NOTE: The reason for this class is that someday it will support a recipient list which will be a variable sized set of addresses that the message should be delivered to. By encapsulating the construction of message headers into a class like this one, variable sized headers can be easily supported.

Hypertable::HeaderBuilder::HeaderBuilder ( uint8_t  protocol,
uint32_t  gid = 0 
) [inline]

Constructor.

Initializes the m_protocol and m_group_id members with the supplied arguments, all other members are set to 0.

Parameters:
protocol application protocol, can be one of PROTOCOL_NONE, PROTOCOL_DFSBROKER, PROTOCOL_HYPERSPACE, PROTOCOL_HYPERTABLE_MASTER, PROTOCOL_HYPERTABLE_RANGESERVER (see Header)
gid the group ID. If the server is using an ApplicationQueue, then request messages with the same group ID will get carried out in series

Member Function Documentation

void Hypertable::HeaderBuilder::initialize_from_request ( Header::Common *  header  )  [inline]

This method is used to initialize a response header from a give request header.

It pulls the ID, the group ID, and the flags from the given request header.

Parameters:
header pointer to the request message header

void Hypertable::HeaderBuilder::encode ( uint8_t **  bufp  ) 

Encodes the header to the given buffer.

Advances the buffer pointer by the length of the header written.

Parameters:
bufp address of buffer pointer to write header to

Definition at line 27 of file HeaderBuilder.cc.

void Hypertable::HeaderBuilder::set_flags ( uint8_t  flags  )  [inline]

Sets the flags member of the header builder.

Currently this is only used internally by the Comm layer and the 0th bit is a flag that indicates whether the message is a request or a response.

Parameters:
flags new set of flags
